docs.abstract: In Transit blog on travel etiquette survey conducted by Travel Leaders Group; more than 800 travelers were asked how they would respond to hypothetical situations common in real life on the road. Photo (S)
docs.snippet: The phrase ''travel etiquette'' may at times seem like an oxymoron, but the Travel Leaders Group of agents surveyed more than 800 people this spring and found broad areas of agreement on how to respond in hypothetical situations that are fairly co...
docs.lead_paragraph: The phrase ''travel etiquette'' may at times seem like an oxymoron, but the Travel Leaders Group of agents surveyed more than 800 people this spring and found broad areas of agreement on how to respond in hypothetical situations that are fairly common in real life on the road. Confronted with the perennial question of whether to tell the person whose headphones are so loud that everyone can hear the dialogue of his in-flight entertainment, nearly three-quarters of respondents said that they would ask him to turn it down or solicit a flight attendant to. And if a child is kicking your seat? More than 6 of 10 would say something directly to the child or to the parent. What about getting upgraded to first class when your travel companion doesn't? Nearly 30 percent said that they'd remain loyal and tough it out in steerage.

headline.main: A Survey on Who Shushes And Who Just Grumbles

docs.abstract: Chef and author Anthony Bourdain will host a weekend program exploring food and culture on CNN after his Travel Channel shows end. Photo (S)
docs.snippet: 2:49 p.m. | Updated  Anthony Bourdain is about to take a television trip.     The chef and author will host a weekend program on CNN beginning early next year, once his shows for the Travel Channel end, CNN announced on Tuesday. CNN said in a news...
docs.lead_paragraph: 2:49 p.m. | Updated Anthony Bourdain is about to take a television trip. The chef and author will host a weekend program on CNN beginning early next year, once his shows for the Travel Channel end, CNN announced on Tuesday. CNN said in a news release that the program ''will be shot on location and examine cultures from around the world through their food and dining and travel rituals.'' Mr. Bourdain will also be a commentator on CNN's channels in the United States and elsewhere.

headline.main: Anthony Bourdain To Host CNN Show

docs.abstract: Amadeus reports third-quarter net profits fell 33 percent; warns of possible fourth-quarter loss (S)
docs.snippet: The travel distribution company Amadeus, hit by the collapse in business affecting the travel industry after the Sept. 11 terrorist attacks, has reported a 33 percent drop in third-quarter net profits and warned of a possible loss in the fourth qu...
docs.lead_paragraph: The travel distribution company Amadeus, hit by the collapse in business affecting the travel industry after the Sept. 11 terrorist attacks, has reported a 33 percent drop in third-quarter net profits and warned of a possible loss in the fourth quarter if bookings do not recover. The company, whose major shareholders include the European airlines Iberia, Air France and Lufthansa, said it was considering financial incentives to get passengers flying again. Emma Daly (NYT)

headline.main: World Business Briefing | Europe: Spain: Falling Profits At Amadeus
